components.name: Collaborative Filtering

fields.description:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.hadoop.item.RecommenderMapper$CooccurrenceCache.get(RecommenderMapper.java:169)
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.hadoop.item.RecommenderMapper$CooccurrenceCache.get(RecommenderMapper.java:154)
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.impl.common.Cache.getAndCacheValue(Cache.java:125)
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.impl.common.Cache.get(Cache.java:94)
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.hadoop.item.RecommenderMapper.map(RecommenderMapper.java:111)
	at org.apache.mahout.cf.taste.hadoop.item.RecommenderMapper.map(RecommenderMapper.java:52)
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.MapRunner.run(MapRunner.java:50)
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.MapTask.runOldMapper(MapTask.java:358)
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.MapTask.run(MapTask.java:307)
	at org.apache.hadoop.mapred.Child.main(Child.java:170)

creator.name: huiwenhan
creator.emailAddress: huiwen dot han at gmail dot com

reporter.name: huiwenhan
reporter.emailAddress: huiwen dot han at gmail dot com

comments.body: I can fix the NPE (just did) but I think there is still an issue here. It's not able to load a column vector that was previously generated. Try it again now to gather more information as I look into it.

author.name: everest
author.emailAddress: rajat dot tibrewal at gmail dot com

comments.body:
My theory:

The error happens at get(RecommenderMapper.java:169) "value = map.get(key, columnVector).get();" because columnVector is still unassigned.

The columnVector init typically happens in the configure(JobConf jobConf) method of RecommenderMapper class.

Reference to map(RecommenderMapper.java:111) is from run(MapRunner.java:50).

Closer inspection of MapRunner.java shows the use of a mapper of class Mapper which RecommenderMapper implements. However, the method configure(JobConf jobConf) is never invoked on this mapper and hence the columnVector is never initialized. This would lead to NPE finally.

Suggested modification: A check for cooccurrenceColumnCache==null in the map(RecommenderMapper.java:52)
OR
suitable corrections to MapRunner.java code.

updateAuthor.name: everest
updateAuthor.emailAddress: rajat dot tibrewal at gmail dot com

comments.body: It's not quite that -- columnVector is assigned in the constructor and is never null, so can't cause the NPE. It would be inside the call to get() anyhow if that's the case. columnVector is not initialized in configure(). configure() is def. called by the framework though I don't know exactly where. MapRunner isn't within our code in any event.

author.name: everest
author.emailAddress: rajat dot tibrewal at gmail dot com

updateAuthor.name: huiwenhan

comments.body:
I can change Cache to handle null values, but I think it's just disguising another problem. The cache should never be unable to load the column vector, since it should have generated a column vector for all. This is the underlying issue.

Actually... my implementation of Retriever in RecommenderMapper is wrong. It should never return null. It should treat this situation as an error and throw an exception, which would be clearer. I should really change it to do that.

That doesn't solve the problem, but it makes it clearer where the problem is:

I think there is perhaps some issue in MapFilesMap? If I had to guess, this is where the issue is. It should be reading from all the intermediate map files that an earlier stage outputs to find column vectors. The fact that it's not finding them suggests that's where the issue is.

I don't have your data or your setup so have some difficulty debugging from here. If you are in a position to look into the code, can you examine whether MapFilesMap seems to find all of those map files correctly, read them, etc.?

author.name: huiwenhan
author.emailAddress: huiwen dot han at gmail dot com

comments.body:
there has one situation:

some user only has one item,
so in UserVectorToCooccurrenceMapper class
there is no output for this item ,

so can not Retrieve the similar item for this item in RecommenderMapper.

am I　right?

updateAuthor.name: huiwenhan
updateAuthor.emailAddress: huiwen dot han at gmail dot com

comments.body: Ah... I think you are correct. Let me construct another fix tonight.
Tentatively resolving with Hui's final suggested change (just allow null column vector).
